Boom¶

class components.fuselage.boom.Boom(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class will create a dual boom connection between the Main wing’s spar line and the front face of the connector described in ‘CompoundStabilizer’.

Returns:

ParaPy Geometry of the Booms
Parameters:
  • wing_in (Wing) – This is the Wing instantiation to build the booms.
  • tail_in (CompoundStabilizer) – This is the CompoundStabilizer instantiation with connectors to build the booms.
  • diameter_factor (float) – This is a factor to scale the boom diameter to the connector diameter so they fit inside one another.
  • ply_number (int) – This is the number of carbon fiber pre-preg plys which the hollow booms are to be made of.
component_type[source]¶

An identifier to be able to lump masses together. Possible entries: ‘wing’ ‘fuselage’ ‘vt’ ‘ht’ ‘ct’ ‘boom’ ‘payload’ ‘prop’ ‘battery’ ‘electronics’

Returns:Component Type
external_shape[source]¶

This part is the external shape of the boom.

Returns:Fused Shape
Return type:Fused
internal_shape[source]¶

This overwrites the Part defined in the class Component an internal_shape w/ a Dummy Value

Returns:Fused Shape
Return type:Fused
ply_number¶

Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber http://www.ijera.com/papers/Vol4_issue5/Version%202/J45025355.pdf

wing_end_point[source]¶

Defines the termination point of the boom-extrude.

Returns:Fused Shape
Return type:Fused
